hanzi-su-wiki:
研

Значения

Точить, полировать, шлифовать; изучение, совершенствование

Мнемоника

  • Исследовать, т.е. взвешивать камни 石 на весах 开.

  • Полировать камень 石, сидя на табурете (как 开).

Варианты

硏

молоть; изучать; исследование

heisig_chinese_memo: A stone and two hands which grind away at it when trying to make a sculpture.
koohiiStory1: My stones are so huge that it takes two hands to polish them!
koohiiStory2: You use two hands to polish a stone: one to hold it and the other to rub it.
jp_example_words:
研ぐ(とぐ): to sharpen, to grind, to scour, to hone, to polish, to wash (rice)
研修(けんしゅう): training
研究(けんきゅう): study, research
研究室(けんきゅうしつ): study (room)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A stone lantern is an excellent way to sharpen anything, even in the dark. Your knives, your forks, your spoons, and even your sword.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine walking around at night and you need to sharpen your sword. You walk up to a stone lantern and rub your sword all over it to sharpen it. Touch the blade. Indeed, it's been sharpened!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Why did you sharpen your blade? Because you are about to do battle with Ken (けん), the famous samurai warrior.
WaniKani_Reading_Info:
You'll want to remember this character, because he will come up many times throughout your WaniKani journey. Ken the samurai used to work for WaniKani, but then he went rogue because he thought WaniKani wasn't being radical enough. So now he wanders the website carrying his squid friend (who you'll meet later) in a bucket.
To help you visualize him, imagine a samurai with armor made from crab shells, a helmet that is just an alligator head, and swords with crab claw hand guards. His great beard and mustache are styled in the shape of whatever kanji is giving you the most trouble at the time.
Ru_Radicals: ｜, ノ, 亅 (зазубрина), 口 (рот), 廾 (двадцать), 石 (камень)
Ru_trainchinese:
yán: (графема) изучать, исследовать
yán: (глаг) молоть, растирать
Kanshudo_mnemonic: start (开) with a stone (石) to sharpen
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A stone and two hands which grind away at it when trying to make a sculpture.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " stone " to the sound of "幵". The original meaning is grinding, that is, fine grinding to crush or smooth. "Said Wen": "Research, Dian Ye. From the stone, the sound." Such as "Lu Shi Chunqiu. "Master": "Song Zhixuan is good at solving cattle...nineteen years with a knife, and the blade is as new as a new research. It is logical and sincere." "Qi Min Yaoshu. "Growing plums and apricots": "When apricots and plums are ripe, harvest the rotten ones, grind them in a basin, squeeze the thick juice out of raw cloth, spread them in a dish, expose them to dryness, and scrape them by hand."

" Research " is extended to mean a tool for grinding ink, and is also called " inkstone ." For example, in "Jijiu Pian", "Pen Research to Raise Yun Ointment and Fire Candle", Yan Shigu's note: "Research, so research ink." "Banliang Biography": "The big man has no ambitions, and he should still follow the example of Fu Jiezi and Zhang Qian in serving a foreign land in order to win the title.

" Research " is also extended to mean research and inquiry. Such as "Zhou Yi. "Xi Ci": "A person who can talk about the hearts, study the concerns of the princes, determine the good and bad of the world, and become the world's I." Kong Yingda Shu: "Research, Jing Ye." "Three Kingdoms. Wei Shu. "Wu Di Ji": "The emperor studies his wisdom, thinks that the emperor is difficult, the official is the best, and the good people must be promoted. It is to use the Xijun to accept the honor."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " stone " to the " si " sound. The original meaning is grinding, that is, fine grinding to crush or smooth.
humanum_full_description:
從「石」，「幵」聲。本義是研磨，即細磨使之粉碎或光滑。《說文》：「研，䃺也。从石，幵聲。」如《呂氏春秋．精通》：「宋之庖丁好解牛……用刀十九年，刃若新𨟖研，順其理，誠乎牛也。」《齊民要術．種梅杏》：「杏李熟時，多收爛者，盆中研之，生布絞取濃汁，塗盤中，日曝乾，以手磨刮取之。」

　　「研」引申表示磨墨的工具，又作「硯」。如《急就篇》「筆研籌筭膏火燭」，顏師古注：「研，所以研墨也。」《後漢書．班梁列傳》：「大丈夫無它志略，猶當效傅介子、張騫立功異域，以取封侯，安能久事筆研間乎？」

　　「研」也引申表示鑽研、探究。如《周易．繫辭下》：「能說諸心，能研諸侯之慮，定天下之吉凶，成天下之亹亹者。」孔穎達疏：「研，精也。」《三國志．魏書．武帝紀》：「君研其明哲，思帝所難，官才任賢，群善必舉，是用錫君納陛以登。」
humanum_short_description: 從「石」，「幵」聲。本義是研磨，即細磨使之粉碎或光滑。

從「 石 」，「 幵 」聲。本義是研磨，即細磨使之粉碎或光滑。《說文》：「研，䃺也。从石，幵聲。」如《呂氏春秋．精通》：「宋之庖丁好解牛……用刀十九年，刃若新𨟖研，順其理，誠乎牛也。」《齊民要術．種梅杏》：「杏李熟時，多收爛者，盆中研之，生布絞取濃汁，塗盤中，日曝乾，以手磨刮取之。」 「 研 」引申表示磨墨的工具，又作「 硯 」。如《急就篇》「筆研籌筭膏火燭」，顏師古注：「研，所以研墨也。」《後漢書．班梁列傳》：「大丈夫無它志略，猶當效傅介子、張騫立功異域，以取封侯，安能久事筆研間乎？」 「 研 」也引申表示鑽研、探究。如《周易．繫辭下》：「能說諸心，能研諸侯之慮，定天下之吉凶，成天下之亹亹者。」孔穎達疏：「研，精也。」《三國志．魏書．武帝紀》：「君研其明哲，思帝所難，官才任賢，群善必舉，是用錫君納陛以登。」

Such as "Lu Shi Chunqiu. "Master": "Song Zhixuan is good at solving cattle...nineteen years with a knife, and the blade is as new as a new research. It is logical and sincere." "Qi Min Yaoshu. "Growing plums and apricots": "When apricots and plums are ripe, harvest the rotten ones, grind them in a basin, squeeze the thick juice out of raw cloth, spread them in a dish, expose them to dryness, and scrape them by hand." " Research" is extended to mean a tool for grinding ink, and is also called " inkstone." For example, in "Jijiu Pian", "Pen Research to Raise Yun Ointment and Fire Candle", Yan Shigu's note: "Research, so research ink." "Banliang Biography": "The big man has no ambitions, and he should still follow the example of Fu Jiezi and Zhang Qian in serving a foreign land in order to win the title. 研字的基本解释

研
yán
细磨（m?），碾：研磨。研药。研墨。
深入地探求：研究。钻研。研京练都（d?）（晋代左思作《三都赋》构思了十二年，后遂用“研京练都”形容经年累月地构思文章）。

研
yàn
古同“砚”，砚台。

研字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yán］
［《廣韻》五堅切，平先，疑。］
亦作“揅1”。“硏1”的新字形。
(1)穷究；精研。
(2)思虑；思考。
(3)研磨；研细。
(4)碾压平整。
(5)精细；详尽。
(6)敲击。
(7)专；竭尽。参见“研心”、“研精殫力”。
(8)通“妍”。见“研研”。
(9)通“妍”。见“研和”、“研美”、“研豔”。
(10)见“研桑”。
[②]［yàn］
［《廣韻》吾甸切，去霰，疑。］
“硏2”的新字形。通“硯1”。
(1)砚台。
(2)滑石。
[③]［xíng］
“硏3”的新字形。
见“石研關”。

研字的英文翻译

◎ 研
grind, pestle, study

研字的康熙字典解释
研字的源字形

研字的起名意思

：1、详尽，精细，如研深，精深。2、妍好，也作“妍” ，如研和，美好温和。

research
Basic explanation of words
research
yán
Fine grinding (m?), grinding: grinding. Research medicine. Research ink.
In-depth exploration: research. Delve into. Studying the Capital of Beijing (d?) (Zuo Si of the Jin Dynasty conceived the "Sandu Fu" for twelve years, and then used "Researching the Capital of Capital" to describe the essay conceived over the years).
research
yàn
Gu Tong "Inkstone", inkstone.
research
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yán］
["Guangyun" five hard cuts, flat first, doubt. ]
Also known as "揅1". The new glyph of "硏1".
(1) Poor research; refined research.
(2) Thinking; thinking.
(3) Grind; grind fine.
(4) Rolling and smoothing.
(5) Fine; detailed.
(6) Percussion.
(7) Specialized; exhausted. See "Researching the Heart", "Researching the Precision".
(8) Through "Yan". See "Research".
(9) Pass "Yan". See "Yanhe", "Yanmei", "Yanyan".
(10) See "Yan Sang".
[②]［yàn］
["Guangyun" Wudian cut, go to hail, doubt. ]
The new glyph of "硏2". Link "Inkstone 1".
(1) Inkstone.
(2) Talc.
[③]［xíng］
The new glyph of "硏3".
See "Shiyanguan".

research

research
Name meaning
:1. Detailed and refined, such as deep research and profound. 2. Yan is good, also called "Yan", such as research and harmony, beautiful and gentle.
研
形声字。石表意,篆书之形像山崖下有块石头,表示用石磨物;开(nidn)表声,开有齐平义,表示研是用底平之石磨
物。本义为磨。引申为研究。
①细磨:~墨|~药。②仔细探求:~究|~讨「钻~。
一钵 ~读 ~磨 ~求 ~习 ~制 精~ 科~

研|研

исследовать
Пиктофонетические символы.
Камень означает, что сценарий печати подобен камню под обрывом, что означает шлифование объекта камнем; отверстие (нидн) выражает звук, а отверстие имеет такое же значение, что означает, что шлифовка является измельчением.
Первоначальное значение - шлифование.
Расширение - исследование.
① Тонкое измельчение: ~ тушь | ~ лекарство.
② Внимательно изучите: ~ исследование | ~ обсуждение «бурения ~».
Чаша ~ читать ~ молоть ~ искать ~ учиться ~ подготовка ~ ке ~
Исследования | Исследования
исследовать
писец
"сетка
yán
1) тереть, оттирать
直研乃见真色 как следует оттереть - только после этого увидишь настоящий цвет предмета
2) растирать, измельчать; толочь; молоть; превращать в порошок
研墨 растирать тушь
研药 растирать порошок (лекарства)
3) докапываться (до сути); изучать, проверять, расследовать (что-л.); доискиваться (чего-л.); вникать (во что-л.)
研诸侯之虑 проникнуть в мысли местных (вассальных) князей
4) Янь (фамилия)

研

Значения

Точить, полировать, шлифовать; изучение, совершенствование

Мнемоника

  • Исследовать, т.е. взвешивать камни 石 на весах 开.

  • Полировать камень 石, сидя на табурете (как 开).

Варианты

硏

Radicals: 石, 开  (stone, lantern)
Meaning Mnemonic
A stone lantern is an excellent way to sharpen anything, even in the dark. Your knives, your forks, your spoons, and even your sword.
Imagine walking around at night and you need to sharpen your sword. You walk up to a stone lantern and rub your sword all over it to sharpen it. Touch the blade. Indeed, it's been sharpened!
Reading Mnemonic
Why did you sharpen your blade? Because you are about to do battle with Ken (けん), the famous samurai warrior.
You'll want to remember this character, because he will come up many times throughout your WaniKani journey. Ken the samurai used to work for WaniKani, but then he went rogue because he thought WaniKani wasn't being radical enough. So now he wanders the website carrying his squid friend (who you'll meet later) in a bucket.
To help you visualize him, imagine a samurai with armor made from crab shells, a helmet that is just an alligator head, and swords with crab claw hand guards. His great beard and mustache are styled in the shape of whatever kanji is giving you the most trouble at the time.

｜, ノ, 亅 (зазубрина), 口 (рот), 廾 (двадцать), 石 (камень)
